scenes.background: [Bob] is pacing around the office, looking stressed. [Monica] sits at her desk, typing quickly.
scenes.description: ‘Can someone explain why this project is delayed? Monica, were you supposed to handle this?’

options.text: Let's not point fingers. We should focus on resolving the issue.
options.analysis: You tried to de-escalate the situation by focusing on a solution rather than assigning blame, showing strong perception and self-regulation.

options.text: Monica, it seems Bob is upset. Could you give us an update?
options.analysis: You acknowledged Bob's emotions and directed the conversation back to Monica, demonstrating empathy and social skills.

options.text: Bob, maybe we should discuss this privately later.
options.analysis: You suggested taking the conversation offline to avoid public conflict, showing social skill but lower empathy and motivation to immediately resolve the issue.
